entry.title: NGI Zero: Search and Discovery Fund
entry.summary: NLnet manages the NGI0 Discovery Fund, a fund dedicated to search technologies which creates an open, trustworthy and reliable internet for all. The fund was established with financial support from the European Commission's Next Generation Internet programme, under the aegis of DG Communications Networks, Content and Technology.
entry.content: NLnet manages the NGI0 Discovery Fund, a fund dedicated to search technologies which creates an open, trustworthy and reliable internet for all. The fund was established with financial support from the European Commission's Next Generation Internet programme, under the aegis of DG Communications Networks, Content and Technology.

entry.title: Combsee
entry.summary:
Decentralized search for more privacy.

A research and development project for a new type of decentralized, privacy preserving, search engine based on its mathematical design. The aim of this project is to design a seriously open source alternative to the well known commercial search engines.
entry.content:
Decentralized search for more privacy.

A research and development project for a new type of decentralized, privacy preserving, search engine based on its mathematical design. The aim of this project is to design a seriously open source alternative to the well known commercial search engines.

entry.title: Primes (part 04): Playing around
entry.summary:

entry.title: Primes (part 01): Recursion basics
entry.summary:
• I. Page 1 - 4: Basic equations and solution of the non-times-table equations intersection
  • II. Page 5 - 5: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation
  • III. Page 6 - 7: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation - Floor corrections
  • IV. Page 8 - 14: General form of the intersection of an arbitrary number of non-times-table equations
  • V. Page 15 - 16: Non-times-table equation correction of Y i to the valid range, by substi- tution
  • VI. Page 17 - 20: Restriction on only odd solutions and the final, general intersection equation
  • VII. Page 21 - 22: Verification that our new (modified) equation is also valid (can used without restrictions) during every recursion step
  • VIII. Page 23 - 27: Determine valid Y i and z i, j ranges
  • IX. Page 28 - 28: Approximations for Floor function
  • X. Page 29 - 30: Let’s put all together. ToDo.
entry.content:
• I. Page 1 - 4: Basic equations and solution of the non-times-table equations intersection
  • II. Page 5 - 5: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation
  • III. Page 6 - 7: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation - Floor corrections
  • IV. Page 8 - 14: General form of the intersection of an arbitrary number of non-times-table equations
  • V. Page 15 - 16: Non-times-table equation correction of Y i to the valid range, by substi- tution
  • VI. Page 17 - 20: Restriction on only odd solutions and the final, general intersection equation
  • VII. Page 21 - 22: Verification that our new (modified) equation is also valid (can used without restrictions) during every recursion step
  • VIII. Page 23 - 27: Determine valid Y i and z i, j ranges
  • IX. Page 28 - 28: Approximations for Floor function
  • X. Page 29 - 30: Let’s put all together. ToDo.
